content.text:
# List of awards and nominations received by Donald Glover

}}
Donald Glover is an American actor, comedian, director, rapper and screenwriter, also known under the stage name Childish Gambino. He has received numerous accolades including a two Primetime Emmy Awards, five Grammy Awards, two Golden Globe Awards, two Peabody Awards, Critics' Choice Award, and five Writers Guild of America Awards as well as a nomination for a Screen Actors Guild Award.
Glover started his career as a comedy writer for the NBC sitcom 30 Rock starting in 2006. There he earned three Writers Guild of America Awards for Television: Comedy Series. During that time he took on the role of Troy Barnes in the NBC sitcom Community (2009–2014), where he won The Comedy Award for Breakout Performer of the Year as well as nominations for an NAACP Image Award and Satellite Award.
He was able to transition to more mature work as an actor, creator, and showrunner for the FX dramedy series Atlanta (2016–2022). He played Earnest "Earn" Marks, a music manager for which he won the Primetime Emmy Award and a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Comedy Series, becoming the first African American to win in the former category. For the show's first three seasons, he received nine Primetime Emmy Award nominations that resulted in two wins, Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series and Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series.
For his work as host and musical guest on the sketch series Saturday Night Live earned him a nomination for Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series. He went on to create other series, such as the Amazon Prime Video satirical black comedy series Swarm (2023) and the Amazon spy series Mr. & Mrs. Smith (2024–present), receiving a nomination for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series for the latter.
For his music, Glover released his first studio album Camp (2011), followed by his second studio album Because the Internet (2013), the later of which was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Rap Album. His single on that album "3005" was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Rap Performance. Glover released his third studio album "Awaken, My Love!" (2016) which was nominated for two Grammy Awards for Album of the Year and Best Urban Contemporary Album. His single from that album, "Redbone" won the Grammy Award for Best Traditional R&B Performance.
In 2018, he released the single "This is America" which received critical attention and was popular with audiences. The single won four Grammy Awards for Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Best Rap/Sung Performance and Best Music Video. Gambino with Kaytranada released the studio album Timeless (2024) which was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Dance/Electronic Recording. That same year, Glover released his fifth studio album Bando Stone & the New World (2024) which was nominated for the Grammy Award for Best Progressive R&B Album.
